attributes.action: Free Ronald Biggs on humanitarian grounds
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Keeping Ronald Biggs in prison and ignoring the parole board's reccomendation to release him on compassionate grounds is unfair due to the state of his deteriorating health.

Members of the same gang who went on the run in foreign Countries were recaptured and sentenced to less years than Ronald Biggs and were let out in a lesser time than he is currently serving.

It is therefore, a punitive action that sees a wheelchair bound man who has suffered strokes, brain haemorrages and is unable to walk, talk or feed himself by keeping him within the over crowded prison system.

Great Britain is considered a Country that the world should look to for moral guidance and we are a Country that asks others to show restraint. 

This lack of judgement by Jack Straw is everything that this Country is not and if a Nation is best judged by the way it treats its prisoners within its own prison system, then a decision to release Ronald Biggs on compassionate grounds would best describe Great Britain.

We ask Jack Straw, the Justice Secretary, to free him immediately.

rejection.details: As stated in our terms and conditions, we cannot accept petitions on individual legal cases. Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
